It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to red. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine, hairy texture. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, Kengia bulgarica is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
